text.0: let your bestbearing car that must be lauded neer injured bring you vājas and Ṛbhukṣans.
text.1: fill you fairhelmeted with mighty soma thricemixed at our libations to delight you.
text.2: ye who behold the light of heaven Ṛbhukṣans give our rich patrons unmolested riches.
text.3: drink heavenlynatured at our sacrifices and give us bounties for the hymns we sing you.
text.4: for thou o bounteous one art used to giving at parting treasure whether small or ample.
text.5: filled full are both thine arms with great possessions thy goodness keeps thee not from granting riches.
text.6: indra highfamed as vāja and Ṛbhukṣans thou goest working singing to the dwelling.
text.7: lord of bay steeds this day may we vasisthas offer our prayers to thee and bring oblations.
text.8: thou winnest swift advancement for thy servant through hymns lord of bay steeds which thou hast favoured.
text.9: for thee with friendly succour have we battled and when o indra wilt thou grant us riches.
text.10: to us thy priests a home as twere thou givest when indra wilt thou recognize our praises.
text.11: may thy strong steed through our ancestral worship bring food and wealth with heroes to our dwelling.
text.12: though nirrti the goddess reigneth round him autumns with food in plenty come to indra.
text.13: with three close friends to length of days he cometh he whom men let not rest at home in quiet.
text.14: promise us gifts o savitar may riches come unto us in parvatas full bounty.
text.15: may the celestial guardian still attend us preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
